sentences.sContent: Suddenly I saw a young male ruby-throated hummingbird in what had been a patch of flowering tobacco.
sentences.sContent_eng: Suddenly I saw a young male ruby-throated hummingbird in what had been a patch of flowering tobacco.
sentences.sCn: 突然，在一块种过烟草花的地里，我看见一只颈部深红色的幼小雄蜂鸟。

sentences.sContent: Implanted sensors show that a hummingbird's wing flaps so fast that the brain is generating the muscle signal for the downbeat of its wing while the wing is still going up.
sentences.sContent_eng: Implanted sensors show that a hummingbird's wing flaps so fast that the brain is generating the muscle signal for the downbeat of its wing while the wing is still going up.
sentences.sCn: 植入的传感器表明，蜂鸟翅膀击打的速度如此之快，以至于当其脑部发出的肌肉信号命令翅膀向下挥动时，但翅膀还是向上挥。

sentences.sContent: I can preserve his inspiring legacy more powerfully through writing than through the hummingbird pendant I wear around my neck to honor his homeland of Trinidad, or a picture or heirloom.
sentences.sContent_eng: I can preserve his inspiring legacy more powerfully through writing than through the hummingbird pendant I wear around my neck to honor his homeland of Trinidad, or a picture or heirloom.
sentences.sCn: 比起我脖子上佩戴的那个纪念他的故乡特立尼达的蜂鸟链坠，或者一张照片，一个传家宝，写作可以让我更得宜有力地继承他那些激动人心的遗产。

remMethod.val: humming(嗡嗡叫) + bird(鸟) → 扇动翅膀发出嗡嗡声的鸟 → 蜂鸟

words.tran: 蜂鸟；蜂鸣器，发嗡嗡声的东西

trans.tranOther: A hummingbird is a small brightly coloured bird found in North, Central and South America. It has a long thin beak and powerful narrow wings that can move very fast.
